column4: How would I go about fixing "to be installed" & "is uninstallable" problems in 11.10?
Are you talkingabout in the Aptitude package manager?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Boot-Repair
Out of curosity, what is the package(s) that your brother is trying to install?
scratch
It's made for Elementary but no one's ever in there.
Is this a fresh installation? If it isn't, you can try running "sudo apt-get update", then try scratch via 'apt-get install scratch'

it is a fresh installation. he added the PPA (it's still in the testing phases) and I told him to run the sudo update command, but wehn he tried to chek it for installation in Synaptic it gave him unsatisfiable errors.

the only thing I can think of is that it doesn't have the required dependencies, which would lead to it not being able to being installed. Generally though, Synaptic would auto-download those dependies... pretty weird.
give me a minute and I'll try to get it up and running on my VM and I'll get back to you.
ok
Have you attempted to use the 'apt-get install scratch' command after adding the ppa and using 'apt-get update'?
You would have to install those dependies before attempting the install. Just type 'apt-get install (package)'. It'll go one by one, but it should work after you've met them all.
some of the packages are installed but their the old versions. some of the others aren;t even in the elementary/oneiric repos either.
Scartch installation successful by using the .deb installer: https://launchpad.net/~scratch/+archive/ppa/+files/scratch_1.4.0.1-0ubuntu5_i386.deb
This is the Scratch EnigmaticEffigy was talking about: https://launchpad.net/scratch
This download should work for that: http://launchpad.net/scratch/1.0/1.0/+download/scratch_1.0-0~293~oneiric1_i386.deb
I got the same program from that. it appears they are the same thing.
Upon attempting to install, the .deb installer responded that there was a newer version already installed (I now have 1.5 installed)
The scratch he installed look more like a sprite editor than a Text Editor. Sorry if I'm sounding harsh.
I wish I could say they were different, but the package maintaner and everything matches up.
